text:
Hi,
we're going to host our homepage on HubSpot cms under our company domain. In order to be gdpr compliant, we are required to have the user opt in before setting any (tracking-)cookies, is there such a consent tool built in? I have only found something like it under settings > cookies, but it's only applicable when using HubSpot tracking on 3rd party pages, which is not what we're doing.
And if there's no consent tool built in - where can I adjust the embed code of HubSpot javascript files in order to implement a 3rd party cookie consent tool like usercentrics?
Thank you
Thanks! Seems to be working now

Thanks, the 2nd link appeared to be exactly what I need, however after enabling it doesn't show up on the homepage, and like it sais on the link "These settings apply to all *external* pages with the HubSpot tracking code".
I need it for HubSpot *internal* pages though.

The cookiebot app looks promising, but since we're already using usercentrics on our other pages, we'd rather use that instead of another consent tool. I could not find an app for that
Hello, is there a way to enroll a contact to a workflow or a webhook if he was added to any list, not a specific one? or enroll when list is created?
